security: Releasing the correspondence might reveal the specific interests and priorities of the Senate Select Committee concerning intelligence matters, which could be exploited by adversaries. The memo itself does not contain sensitive information.
summary: Michael E. Shaheen, Jr., Special Counsel for Intelligence Coordination, forwards a Senate Select Committee request to John A. Mintz of the FBI, instructing him to prepare an appropriate response.
summary_one_paragraph: On November 11, 1975, Michael E. Shaheen, Jr., the Special Counsel for Intelligence Coordination, sent a memo to John A. Mintz, Assistant Director of the Legal Counsel Division of the FBI, regarding a request from the Senate Select Committee received by Shaheen's office on November 10, 1975; the memo instructs Mintz to prepare a response to the committee's letter.
title: Senate Select Committee Request
origin_agency: Office of the Deputy Attorney General
sender: Michael E. Shaheen, Jr., Special Counsel for Intelligence Coordination
